version_description:
• FIXED Issue where tracks would be dropped when modifying the queue with Repeat All enabled.
• FIXED Sorting glitch when viewing Albums Tab sorted by artist.
• FIXED crash when trying to view Track Details from within a search.

• IMPROVED Th

• Let’s be real, Cs was pretty great but it started up like a 56k modem without the dubstep. Launch times have been dramatically reduced so you can get to listening to your music instead of waiting for the drop.
• Added a convenient long-swipe for Play

Turned out that artist images could be more hidden. In Genres, specifically. So fixed that and a bug in Now Playing involving low-res artwork.

If you skipped 3.8.4, here's what you missed:
• Let’s be real, Cs was pretty great but it started up l

• State restoration has been fixed so Cs will now pick up where you left off, again.
• Now you can choose whether or not tracks added to a shuffling queue should be shuffled in automatically. This option can be found in the Shuffle Modes menu accessed
• Fixed a bug that paused playback when shaking to shuffle.

It's been a while between updates, but that doesn't mean lots hasn't been happening! This is a big update, so please read all the way to the end – there are some important announcements. But first, what's new:

• The queueing system has be

“Bugs. Why does it always have to be bugs?” Indie muttered to himself.

The bugs were elusive, skittering away from the torchlight. In the centre of the chamber was a block of amber rising on a stone pedestal. Embedded inside the block was the myste

What Indie didn’t realize was that a particularly vicious bug had dropped onto his back in the Playlist Tunnel. He hadn’t felt it earlier because he was still wearing a well-used Leather Jacket 6. The bug slowly climbed down his back and onto a rock and u

This update simply contains some stability updates and minor layout tweaks for iOS 11. The next version, 3.9.4 will be much more important, but *how* depends on how you've played the Choose Your Own Adventure game we all call life. When you saw the iOS 11

Finally! Version 3.9.4 is here, and brings with it optimizations for iOS 11 playback:

• Gapless playback has been restored.
• Playback interruptions have been eliminated and minimized wherever possible. They aren't totally gone, but wh

Pretty simple one:
• Collecting playlists by rating is back.
• Sorting playlists and All Songs lists by rating is back too, plus you can now also use it on albums.
• Fixed a track handling bug when skipping backwards
• Fixed a bunch of mi

It's kind of a meme in change logs now to blame recent bugs or issues on a fictitious member of the team, like "Steve" or "Obama." Everyone knows I'm a one-person operation, so I whenever possible I try to blame issues on Apple. This time, though, they pu

Legit, it's just bug fixes.

If you missed the last update, a reminder that performance issues have been addressed by Apple in iOS 11.3 and everything appears to work properly again in the latest beta (11.3b5).
• Fixes an issue toggling shuffle for some new users.

• Corrected slight errors in visual margins across devices and configurations. Exciting, right? I'll wait while you compose yourself. Remember to breathe.
• Minor design revisions to the Theme Settings view.
• Stability improvements to the Queu
Couple minor bug fixes, but I don't want to describe them because it's *embarrassing*, you guys. Queue Clear and widget play buttons now work properly again.

• You know in the horror film, when you're pretty sure the bad guy is dead, but then he's right there when you open the door? Turns out iOS 11.3 wasn't totally done with us. This version adjusts the queue resume feature to compensate for changes to t

My public release brings all the bugs to the yard,
And they're like: "Mike, your new app has flaws and you should feel bad. Perfection is attainable, Mike."

This version fixes some exception cases. Most users never experienced them, but don't wo

• The “Use Grouping” setting used to also enable “Shuffle by Grouping” by default, which was causing a fair bit of confusion. I was answering the same email a lot. So that’s been removed: “Shuffle by Grouping” is now a third option in the “Shuffle Mode” s

A classic "performance improvements" update if there ever was one; but the people demand more, and I know my history. Some users have reported that Queue Resume doesn't work well, dropping back 20-30 tracks which also *just so happens* to be about the mar

• NEW universal search tab. Not only can you search your whole library from this new location but search performance has been improved across all tabs as well.
• NEW queue management system. This new approach a) eliminates playback interruptions for mo

• IMPROVED global search handling of artists and album artists.
• General bug fixes.

• FIXED bug that caused disappearing tracks when sorting individual albums by rating.
• Everyone's favorite miscellaneous bug fixes.
Fixed a number of rare Crashlytics exceptions. I know the new rule is to be more specific in the change logs, but man, these changes were so minor I don't even remember half of them.
• FIXED bug causing Classical Mode selections to be ignored.

• NEW Advanced Queuing mode. What is Advanced Queuing? All the advanced queue features like reordering or removing items from the queue, advanced shuffling (by album or grouping), Resume Queue, etc. So what's new? The ability to turn it all OFF. See, some

• FIXED issue with MiniPlayer presenting on launch when it shouldn't.

And if you missed 4.2:
• NEW Advanced Queuing mode. What is Advanced Queuing? All the advanced queue features like reordering or removing items from the queue, advanced shuffl

FIXED animation glitches in track details pane for content with lyrics.

Very happy to see some 5-star reviews coming in describing improved performance and UX on iOS 12! If you haven't upgraded yet, I strongly urge you to consider it. And if you ar

• FIXED translation bugs in iOS 12
• FIXED minor bugs

• NEW Siri Shortcuts, so you can talk to Cesium like a friend with a tin can telephone. (Open, Search, Shuffle All)
• NEW URL Scheme, so you can write to Cesium like a pen pal whose father was the deposed king of Nigeria (cesium://, cesium://search, ce

This is update is fairly minor:
• IMPROVED miniplayer performance and reliability.
• FIXED miscellaneous bugs.

But the next update is not minor.
Cesium 5 will be API-safe, meaning better performance and reliability. But it also means

• IMPROVED MiniPlayer responsiveness when initiating playback.
• iOS 11 Support
• Minor bug fixes.

In case you missed it:
Cesium 5 has been built API-Safe to be more stable, performant and future-proof than ever. Unfortunate

Did you know...
...that star ratings haven't been removed completely? You can re-enable the rating control in the Now Playing view settings.

• NEW Now Playing option to hide status bar
• IMPROVED localizations
• Moved the rating

• NEW Widget. You complained, I caved. All new Today Widget is entirely focused on star ratings – and is only available when star ratings are enabled in Now Playing settings.
• NEW Ukrainian localization.
• NEW Russian localization.

• IMPROVED playlist sort/collection options. Collect by rating and grouping are back, and all rating/grouping/album options are properly contextual on their respective sorting settings.
• FIXED bug affecting Now Playing view when artwork and statu

• Playlist sort preferences are now saved individually.
• Search URL scheme (cesium://search) can now handle queries for direct search, i.e. cesium://search?zeppelin
• Minor graphics improvements.

Cesium is now Cs Music Player!

• Name change throughout.
• URL Scheme has also changed to csmusic://
• Minor bug fixes
• Stay tuned for another update soon that addresses search bugginess some users are experiencing, and AirPlay 2!

• EXPANDED display name to "Cs Music"
• IMPROVED search bar reliability. Please contact me if you continue to experience issues with search stability, as there is a more "nuclear option."
• Misc. bug fixes, visual tweaks and translati
• Fixes phantom miniplayer controls.

• Searching for the search bar? This update should fix some issues some users were having with no search bar appearing in the Search tab.

My apologies for the delay between updates, which was longer than I'd generally prefer. If you'd like to

• Improved playlist image handling, including custom set images.
• minor bug fixes.

Did you know why things have been quiet lately? Because I've been working on a new app! Miximum is a new music app focused specifically on playlist manageme

• Fixes iOS 13 bug: swipe to dismiss NP
• Fixes iOS 13 bug: missing today extension
• Fixes iOS 13 bug: crash switching between dark and light modes.

If you are interested in a new Cs experience built specifically for iOS 13, check out csmusi

Hey man, iOS 13 came out, like, 2 months ago! Where's the update? What's taking so long?!

Funny thing, is Cs has actually been rebuilt from scratch – TWICE – to get here. The first rebuild is awesome, and brings some pretty substantial innovat

There's always a few bugs and issues that surface after a major update hits the full user base. This should fix some!
• Improves widget handling when no currently playing item.
• Fixes issues with star ratings in the detail pane not persisting.

This version completes the migration from Fabric Crashlytics (which was purchased by Google) to the new Firebase Crashlytics program. Cs has actually been migrated to Firebase for over a year, this just finishes the process because I was starting to see c

• Manual Dark Mode is back! Toggle between always on, always off, or the iOS system setting.
• The iOS 13.4 beta introduced some instability (hopefully just beta stuff), but this includes some adjustments to help account for it.

Did you notice that most of the shuffle commands stopped working? iOS 13.4 decided to become very picky about where and when the shuffle mode is set, so those issues are now resolved.

Stay safe everyone!
• Fixed bug preventing users from viewing track detail when within a track details navigation stack.

Few things to address with this update:

1) This is a quick update with general Crashlytics fixes. Ironically, the #1 issue looks like it was embedded in the Crashlytics framework itself, and those have been updated as well. I've seen a few reports

Well... it took over a year, 100 builds, and somewhere in the middle it became a totally separate app. But Cs 6 is finally here.

This update includes a totally rebuilt UI, which addresses commonly reported user issues and includes some long overdue

SWIPE CONTROLS
Play, shuffle and queue items with a swipe. Supporting this feature in collection views actually required new APIs in iOS 14. Did I hold this feature back to allow iOS 13 users onto Cs 6 and is that a reasonable alibi? Plausible, right?<
